page.title: 14Nature in Bredfield -Animals
page.content: There are several ponds on farms and in gardens in the area. In and around them there are pond snails, water insects, frogs, toads, newts, ducks and flying insects like dragonflies. In the fields there are field mice, hares, rabbits, lizards, moles, shrews, voles, grass snakes, stoats and weasels. Deer can sometimes be seen grazing as they move from one wood to another. Though foxes are rarely seen signs of them can be found in ditches and woods, where there are also red and grey squirrels. Hedgehogs are seen mainly when they have been run over on the road. At dusk bats fly around.
